issue.title: [feat]

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the problem

I want the program to link to the network through the system proxy, but the corresponding solution is not given in the document, I can only use Axios package to achieve this purpose, and I can't use ```fetch``` to send request by proxy

### Describe the solution you'd like

I hope tauri can add this function, like electron using Session to Manage browser sessions, cookies, cache, proxy settings, etc.
and  I just need to modify or add this program statement ``ses.setProxy(config)``` to enable the program to request by proxy

### Alternatives considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.body:
### Feature description

Add a support to set a proxy server

### Motivation

If you try to enter a website from other country, it shows that I don't have access to the website
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78724291/223051937-e018d00c-6cfb-48e6-9a53-0adefafcf310.png)


### Alternatives

Use a VPN

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: Proxy support
issue.body:
Feature request: ability to support configuring an app proxy.

I'm writing this assuming that this is a difficult ask, but I realized I'd tried to look this up before, and I just did the research all over again, so at least if I wrote an issue the first time I (or anyone else) would easily know the situation.

If I understand correctly the app is built on Tauri and proxy support would have to be written into the (rust?) Requests as Tauri itself doesn't have proxy support.

issue.title: feat(http): expose proxy configuration

repository.name: plugins-workspace
repository.description: All of the official Tauri plugins in one place!

issue.body:
The `fetch` method now exposes a proxy field to allow users to configure the proxy for the reqwest client.
Related issues from original repository: 
- [[feat] Proxy support in fetch function in tauri's http API](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/6467)
- [[feat] How to set proxy settings for the webview](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/4263)

Closes tauri-apps/tauri#6467

issue.title: feat(core): add support to setting a webview proxy, closes #4263

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
wry has been supported http/socks5 proxy in [#1006](https://github.com/tauri-apps/wry/pull/1006), which has been merged in [commit 3cc4d79](https://github.com/tauri-apps/wry/commit/3cc4d7984311bebf11a01eb7af094499a3c9ad5f).
    
This patch aims to support its feature.

Related issues from original repository:
- [[feat] Proxy support in fetch function in tauri's http API](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/6467)
- [[feat] How to set proxy settings for the webview](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/4263) 

Related pull request
- [feat(http): expose proxy configuration](https://github.com/tauri-apps/plugins-workspace/pull/824)
